org.eclipse.dataset

Interface IRemoteDataset

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IDynamicDataset, ILazyDataset, IMetadataProvider, INameable, java.io.Serializable

    public interface IRemoteDataset
extends ILazyDataset, IDynamicDataset
    A Remote dataset is a lazy dataset which exists in a remote location. It uses a connection to the DataServer to provide the implementation of the slicing required remotely. You may also listen to data changing in the dataset

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.eclipse.dataset.IDynamicDataset

    • Method Detail

      • getPath

        java.lang.String getPath()
        DataServer path, a local path on the server used to locate the remote dataset.
        Returns:
        the file path to the data in the file system of the remote machine

      • setPath

        void setPath(java.lang.String path)
        DataServer path, a local path on the server used to locate the remote dataset. This path may also be a directory where the data collection will happen. In this case when the first file is written, the dataset must be made up of files with the same extension.
        Parameters:
        path - to the data in the file system of the remote machine

      • getDataset

        java.lang.String getDataset()
        The data set location/name in the file
        Returns:
        Data set

      • setDataset

        void setDataset(java.lang.String dataset)
        The data set location/name in the file
        Parameters:
        dataset -

      • connect

        void connect()
      throws java.lang.Exception
        Cannot will connect with the DataServer to start listening to any updates to the file should it be written in the remote file system. When connect it called, the remote file must exist and the dataset properties are read. These properties must not change in the file while you are connected. For instance if the file is ints when you connect, it must not change data class.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Stops listening to the dataset changing and disconnects from the server. A remote dataset may be connected and disconnected multiple times.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
